benchmark_details.name: FanOutQA
benchmark_details.overview: FanOutQA is a high-quality dataset of fan-out question-answer pairs and human-annotated decompositions with English Wikipedia as the knowledge base, designed to evaluate complex multi-hop, multi-document reasoning capabilities of large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of large language models on complex multi-hop, multi-document reasoning tasks.

data.source: Crowdsourced from undergraduate and graduate students at a university, utilizing English Wikipedia as the knowledge base.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the normalized reference answer strings and models' generated responses.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in answering fan-out questions.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance achieved a loose accuracy of 68.5%.
methodology.validation: Performance validations were conducted through benchmarking seven large language models against the dataset.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No personal identifying information was collected from human participants.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is released under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA).
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants gave informed consent before accepting the tasks.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Data collected from human annotators is IRB exempt under 45 CFR 46.104, category 2.
